definition: to send/to mail/to entrust/to depend on/to attach oneself to/to live (in a house)/to lodge/foster (son etc)
to sell/to make or carry out (a plan or intrigue etc)

sentences.english: He frequents the commission sale store, hoping to fish out some bargain basement goods.
sentences.chinese: 他常光顧寄售商店，想撈點便宜貨。

sentences.english: Your consignment of 30c/s textiles arrived in good condition.
sentences.chinese: 貴公司寄售之30箱紡織品已安然抵達。

sentences.english: My college friends introduced me to trendy thrift and consignment clothing stores.
sentences.chinese: 我的大學同學要我節約，給我介紹寄售商店。

sentences.english: Your consignment of 30 cases textile arrived in excellent condition.
sentences.chinese: 貴公司寄售的30箱紡織品已安然運達。

sentences.english: Here is a contract of Coca - Cola soft drink on consignment .
sentences.chinese: 下面是一份可口可樂軟飲料寄售合同。

sentences.english: DEAR SARA: What's the difference between a consignment shop and a thrift shop?
sentences.chinese: 寄售店和舊貨店的不同之處是什麼？

sentences.english: Under the consignment shop structure, banks would consign only assets with doubtful values.
sentences.chinese: 根據寄售商店的結構，銀行只寄售價值不清的資產。

sentences.english: Under the consignment shop structure, banks would consign only assets with doubtful values.
sentences.chinese: 根據寄售商店的結構，銀行只寄售價值不清的資產。

sentences.english: BUYER shall manage the consignment stock with the care proper to a respectable businessman.
sentences.chinese: 買方應本着敬業的原則妥善管理寄售庫存商品。

sentences.english: What does it take to start a consignment shop?
sentences.chinese: 開一家寄售商店需要做些什麼？

sentences.english: Purchase children's clothing at a consignment shop or on an online auction instead of buying these items new.
sentences.chinese: 儘量在寄售商店或網上拍賣店購買小孩的衣服。

sentences.english: You can find real treasures at consignment shops. Items are often new, if not gently used.
sentences.chinese: 在寄售店，你或許能找到貨真價實的寶貝。

definition: to unbind (e.g. a phone number from an account)
virtual currency created by Baidu for use on its websites (coin.baidu.com)
variant of 訂貨|订货[ding4 huo4]
to provide (an asset) as security for a loan/to put up collateral
store credit (credit to be spent at a specified retailer)
to sell as agent/to sell on commission (e.g. insurance policies)/proxy sale (of stocks)
